title: Baby can't stop cracking up while learning alphabet with dad
text:
Baby can't stop cracking up while learning alphabet with dad originally appeared on goodmorningamerica.com

A baby's contagious laughter is getting love from millions.

Winston Thomas Moore was filmed by his mom, Kiara, as he practiced learning letters with his father, Pedro Moore. The 1-year-old couldn't stop giggling as his dad showed him the letter "W" could also be an "M" upside down.

Last week, Moore shared the sweet footage on Instagram, where it was viewed 30,000 times. Over 1 million more watched after actress Jennifer Garner posted it as well.

(MORE: This sweet baby doing push-ups with his trainer dad is all you need to get through today)

"That was the first time he laughed to that extreme," Moore of Middletown, Delaware, told "Good Morning America. "He's very enjoyable, likes to be silly, loves to learn. He's like a sponge when it comes to learning and anything that involved fun, he's down for."

(MORE: Baby Jonas Brothers fan rocks out with french fry in hand)

Moore said Winston is his and his wife's "miracle baby" since the couple had been trying to have children for five years. Winston's adventures are now documented on the toddler's own Instagram's page, @winstontmoore.
